title: Steve Reed – 2020 Comments on ‘Broken Government Promise’ to Fund Local Councils
author: admin
summary: The comments made by Steve Reed, the Shadow Communities and Local Government Secretary, on 24 September 2020.
content:
Councils are already cutting back frontline services and sacking staff because the Government broke their promise to fully fund them for getting communities through the lockdown. That means they may not have the resources they need to support communities through the second spike in infections or to support local economies that are now in recession.
  *[ERSA]: Employment Related Services Association
  *[HS2]: High Speed Two
  *[GPs]: general practitioners

Instead of learning from their mistakes, incompetent Conservative ministers are repeating them by allowing councils to sink deeper into debt as the new restrictions bite, which will inevitably lead to further cuts, job losses, and threats to local high streets and local economies.
  *[ERSA]: Employment Related Services Association
  *[HS2]: High Speed Two
  *[GPs]: general practitioners

The Government promised to level up communities, but instead they are standing by and leaving them to sink.
  *[ERSA]: Employment Related Services Association
  *[HS2]: High Speed Two
  *[GPs]: general practitioners
